derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin ulcus, ulcer-

entry.def: An ulcer is a sore area on the outside or inside of your body which is very painful and may bleed or produce an unpleasant poisonous substance.

means.word_mean: 1. a circumscribed inflammatory and often suppurating lesion on the skin or an internal mucous surface resulting in necrosis of tissue
